diff_hunk:
@@ -225,8 +226,14 @@ def ref_log_prob(idx, val, log_prob):
             self.assertEqual(log_prob, math.log(prob if val else 1 - prob))
 
         self._check_log_prob(Bernoulli(p), ref_log_prob)
+        self._check_log_prob(Bernoulli(logits=p.log() - (-p).log1p()), ref_log_prob)
body:
I don't think keeping it 100% consistent is worth it, especially that it's not a silent change. It will be immediately clear that you have to use a different name, or you'll get an error.

I'm a bit worried of calling two semantically different things using the same name (if you don't at least have a type system), because that's a recipe for an easy failure that will take a long time to debug.

I don't think keeping it 100% consistent is worth it, especially that it's not a silent change. It will be immediately clear that you have to use a different name, or you'll get an error.
I'm a bit worried of calling two semantically different things using the same name (if you don't at least have a type system), because that's a recipe for an easy failure that will take a long time to debug.
